title: Man, 20, clinging to life as four others hospitalized after being shot by man on Bronx street: police
content:
Guns were blazing in the city over the weekend, sending the number of shootings for the week skyrocketing - doubling over the same period last year.
A 20-year-old man was fighting for his life and four others were hospitalized after a man with a gun approached them on a Bronx street and began firing, police said Sunday.
The group was standing on Creston Ave. near East 184th St. in Fordham Heights when the suspect walked up to them and fired several times about 9 p.m. Saturday, cops said.
A 20-year-old man who was shot in the chest was rushed to St. Barnabus Hospital in critical condition, officials said.
Another 20-year-old man who was shot in the buttocks was also taken to St. Barnabus Hospital, while a 21-year-old man who was shot in the ankle brought himself to the hospital, sources said.
Two men, 26 and 21, who were both shot in the leg, brought themselves to New York-Presbyterian The Allen Hospital, sources said.
Nearby video footage of the scene showed the suspect firing several shots before fleeing, authorities said.
No arrests have been made and the investigation is ongoing. A motive for the shooting was not immediately available.
Shootings are up in the city compared to the same time last year, as there were 44 shooting incidents with 53 victims this week as of 12 a.m. Sunday compared to 21 shooting incidents for the same week in 2014, data shows.
There were eight murders this week, compared to five murders in the same time period last year, according to NYPD data.
